law.text: Though not specifically mentioned in this code, all disorders and neglects to the prejudice of good order and discipline in the state military forces and all conduct of a nature to bring discredit upon the state military forces shall be taken cognizance of by a court-martial and punished at the discretion of a military court. However, where a crime constitutes an offense that violates both this code and the criminal laws of the state where the offense occurs or criminal laws of the United States, jurisdiction of the military court must be determined in accordance with KRS 35.015(2).
law.history: Repealed, reenacted, renumbered, and amended 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 32, sec. 138, effective June 25, 2013. -- Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 56, sec. 92.
